page.title: 09R.A.F. LINK WITH LUDFORD
page.content: In 1943 an airfield was built at Ludford _ home of 101 Squadron's Lanc_ _aster Bombers. Today few buildings left but corn is a different green where runways were. Still strong link with 101 _ Memorial stands in main street and reunion held in September. Today ladies who as girls served the Airmen in Village Canteen, continue to serve & provide grand tea at reunion, contributing much to an event which attracts members from Australia, New Zealand, Canada & S.Africa. In the Church is the Association Standard and Book of Remembrance with the names of 1100 young men, the highest casualties of any RAF Squadron due to 101's Special Operations role.Today only the roar of Lightning Jet Fighters from nearby RAF Binbrook which patrol the N.Sea to intercept Russian planes (Bears) probing our airspace.
